Reviews.Title: “stayed near Camp Jordan Tn.”
Reviews.Author: ovrit
Reviews.Content: we really needed a handicap accessible room. bathroom is to small for even the average person, let alone a person with a walker. barely room to get the walker around the beds. we have had this issue with just about every hotel except with the Seralago in Kissimmee Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Umm Staff are OK place was NOT!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiholidays
Reviews.Content: Well what an eye opener this was!!! Firstly staff were great and helpful but place was a dump dirty bathrooms toilet roll holders falling off the wall beds which had massive craters in them craters that would give even the largest ones on the Moon a run for their money. Pink soap scum and mould around all bathroom surfaces, bathroom reaked of urine. I thought I was being smart by staying in the heart of Graceland wow what a mistake that was. Stay in the downtown area pay a bit more. Please please just don't do it So be warned. To the managers or owners, guys invest in some new bedding and some decent cleaning equipment please i have had better night sleeps on Park benches

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: judjsb
Reviews.Content: My room was nice and clean it's now a Motel 6 very quiet place to stay Amber the desk clerk was very friendly. She went out of her way to help me and make me feel comfortable. My house keeper was also the same way. I'am not sure how the hotel use to be when it was days inn but I had no problems with my stay at all. Only thing I wish they had breakfast. Would stay again if I have to go back to Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “This Motel is now Motel 6, changed over and probably better”
Reviews.Author: mm112233
Reviews.Content: I booked this place online the Motel 6 web site because it listed it as "New Location" and it was cheaper that the others. It basically had a Days Inn sign removed and Motel 6 put up over it. The desk clerk was very nice and offered to help with info, etc. The room was nice. Inspected the bed thoroughly for bed bugs and found none so I stayed. King bed was huge but the matress was old and a strange sleep for me. The room was clean it had all I needed. The pool was open indoors. It is very tiny and not much to it, but it was an extra. Morning had coffee. Wi-fi was free which was nice compaired to other Motel 6's that charge for it. The location may be kind of sketchy, but I am not from Memphis so I don't know. I did not go walking but saw some scary people walking by. I drove about 15 minutes into town to Beale St. and came back for the night then left the next morning. It was a good cheap stay over for me on my cross country drive.

Reviews.Title: “Hell”
Reviews.Author: jlittle44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove up for a weekend get away, checked in after dealing with ruge receptionist walked in smelly room with wall cracking, dinge towels, Went back down for refund within 10 minute i was told we don't usally give refund they offered to show us a better room, when was'nt we offered a good room in the first place in they had a better room, WE WILL NOT BE COMING BACK

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: AWGBlog
Reviews.Content: Check in was a pain, copies made of my credit card and license and I think that's illegal, but I was able to get the copy. Rooms plain and the towels were old, thin and dirty. I've used better towels to dry my dog! The TV was fuzzy with bad reception it was noisy and no place to eat nearby, the gas station next door had bars on the windows and thick glass. The breakfast was a nasty little honey bun and stale cereal. And the clerk was a sleep behind the counter. I will not recommend or ever stay there again, NEVER! And internet was a pain to get on, with logging in, timers and passwords that would allow you to access much at all.

Reviews.Title: “STOLE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: DaysInnVictim37
Reviews.Content: I called and booked one room for two nights in Memphis, TN. I called the next day and cancelled the room, realizing I called the wrong place. I called and stayed at West Memphis, AR Days Inn. The Days Inn in Memphis, TN charged me for not canceling, which I did! On top of that, they had booked two rooms for one night, which was incorrect from the first time I called. I am going to the media and having an attorney pursue this since I have found other articles where this is happening. DO NOT STAY AT DAYS INN so they can NOT charge your credit card whatever they feel like. I am out $240.00 for one of their employees mistake. When I tried to call Corporate, they told be to take it up with the Memphis, TN Manager (Alka), which has stopped returning my phone calls. DAYS INN is a total scam, which is very sad, considering I stayed at one of their properties the same weekend. They still charged me without any hesitation. Bob B. (St. Louis, MO)

Reviews.Title: “best holiday ever”
Reviews.Author: deanowatson
Reviews.Content: great place to stay only thing wrong was no bar or cafe for drinks ,especially on returning from days out. Right across the road from Elvis ( who is still there by the way, felt his presence in Graceland but only on my first visit !!!!) Found circle G ranch, went inside Dolan drive house met 3 people who actually knew Elvis, it was just so much more than we expected. Going back soon.Ann and Neil Newcastle upon tyne England.

Reviews.Title: “Guitar Shaped Pool not Enough”
Reviews.Author: MuskieRob
Reviews.Content: We were going to visit Graceland and wanted to be in walking distance to it. This was our first trip to Memphis and probably the last. The hotel is located almost directly across from Graceland, so that part of our trip was satisfied. Beyond that, the hotel is located in a questionable part of the town not too far from the airport. It does boast a guitar shaped pool that our two daughters enjoyed playing in. It wasn't heated but it wasn't super cold either. We were given a room that was supposed to be non smoking and had signs that state that, but someone who stayed before us obviously ignored the non smoking sign. They did move us to another room without any issues. The front desk was courteous and helpful when asking for directions to a local restaurant. We assumed that Days Inns had internet access in their rooms, you had to bring an ethernet adapter, as they do NOT offer wi fi in their rooms. The rooms were decorated in Elvis decor and the television did offer free Elvis movies 24/7. The television was updated, but not much more. There is a free breakfast bar in the lobby, but come short on amount of tables. We had to sit separately. The food they offered was a decent selection of breakfast foods such as cereal, waffles, Krispy Kremes, coffee, juice, etc. Overall, if you are looking for a Graceland vacation, or are a big Elvis fan, stay here. Otherwise, you may want to move along and find a nicer area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: rebarb
Reviews.Content: We were there for business and pleasure. I was going to make my reservations by internet, but they did not offer the things I needed, so I called the hotel and was told they did not have king beds but the internet advertisement said they did, so I booked the room for 2 queens and the clerk, Barry, gave me my price including $10 per night for my small dog, plus a room without stairs. When we arrived, my room had 2 full beds. I informed the manager, Raj, about the situation and he said "full beds, queen beds or king beds it doesn't matter, there is no guaranty what room or the size bed you reserve", even though we reserved and paid by credit card. I was going to cancel my room but was told that I would have to pay for the first night anyway. The water was cold in the shower, sink stopped up, no iron, no coffee pot and keys would not work. Don't eat the breakfast ,the whole room is very dirty and the carpet is bulking up. People checking in could not get their keys scanned because the machine was broke. Something is not right somewhere. When checking out they charged me and extra $20.00 for my dog, even though, Barry, had given me the price along with a comfirmation number. If you reserve a room at a hotel and submit a valid credit card to hold that room, you should get what you pay for. We traveled 6 hours only to get this. Plus, I have a back injury and cannot sleep well in a full bed. Sweet dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Austin Peay HWY Days Inn - NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: LoriLions
Reviews.Content: I was here for business and pleasure. They accept pets and have stayed at other Days Inn but this one, NEVER AGAIN. The hotel is backed up to the expressway so expect noise. There are no decent restaurants nearby and only a little space to walk your pets. But, thankfully, there are security guards that will keep you safe once it gets dark. The floors were filthy! The carpet made my socks black within minutes and the bathroom toilet ran all night--this was the second room that I was relocated to since the first one actually had toilet water draining all over it. The towels were stained and small-kinda like hand towels. The hotel staff were eating at the breakfast buffet when we arrived which was around 0830. So, the selection was slim. WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN AND DON"T RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: motheroftwo9905
Reviews.Content: One word "Disgusting". To elaborate, our white socks turned black within minutes of taking off our shoes in the room (filty carpet). Our beds did not have fitting sheets. It was a flat sheet draped over the mattress. We had to keep pulling at it to cover the mattress (gross). The bathroom was dirty, floor look like it had not been mopped in ages. The ceiling had mold/mildew in the bathroom. The tile in the shower had soap scum and looked like it hadn't been cleaned in ages. The bottom of the tub was stained black/dirt. Soap scum on the shower curtain, and hair on the tiles of the shower. We had only one roll of toilet paper, of which was only a half of a roll. The double bedded room only had two towels. What is up with that? The towels were very small and very thin, practically transparent. Also some were dirty with god knows what on them (hadn't been cleaned). Hair on towels, and smelt bad. The towels had a green stripe down the middle (very old towels). We ran out, and asked for more. They said they had some at the front desk, and implicated exactly that (the towels were at the front desk). Meaning they weren't going to lift a finger to bring them to us. We had to go get the towels. They only gave us two more. No smoke detectors! We didn't bother with the breakfast. The faster we got out of there the better. Anything that was in that hotel was washed immediately when we got back home. We only continued to stay there because we were exhausted from our days adventures. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Very outdated and Gross, Gross, Gross!!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: jjsidf
Reviews.Content: we travelled from northern manitoba. took us 4 days io get to memphis tn days inn . we always travel with our pets . we arrived at the hotel to see a woman so angry she was threatening the desk clerk and mannager because they were changing the rates of her whole party of wedding guests. our turn they did the same to us . $10 they tried to charge us extra. towels ere see through . 3 days we stayed the room was not cleaned. asked for towels we got 2 and they said they had no extras. there were 4 of us my husband myself and 2 kids. scarey area rough. breakfast was out late and put away early. disgusting rooms . i would never let my dogs stay in such a dump. never recomend to anyone. i could go on . do not stay there

Reviews.Title: “Worst chain hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The two rooms we stayed in at the Days Inn on Austin Peay Hwy. were appalling, and bore no resemblance to the descriptions in the Days Inn 06-07 Worldwide Directory or the hotelâ€™s own flyers. In general, the rooms lacked the basic necessities to make our stay comfortable. Discrepancies in the hotel and rooms advertised and what we had were no more coffee at the Daybreak Breakfast when it ran out, no cable, no HBO: the TVs only had FOUR local channels, no alarm clock radio in either room, no microwave oven in either room, no hot tub in the hotel, no free coffee available in the lobby â€œ24/7â€�, no telephone, no remote control for the TV, no pillows on one bed, no SolTerre shower, only two bath towels of very low quality, and bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Gracelands”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMam
Reviews.Content: Ok this place is pretty rank. Its not pretty to look at but it is very well locatedâ€¦ just opposite Gracelandâ€™s and the free tour buses that run into downtown from there. We asked our room to be changed once but the alternative room was of just as shoddy a state (grim beds, scaly bathroom, stained floors, carpets and sheets), at least it was facing reception so felt a little more secure. Iâ€™d recommended to someone looking for a short stay but its no palace at all, its location and ease of transportation are to be noted though.

Reviews.Title: “please dont stay there needs to be condemned!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Iwish I had read the review of this hotel that a patron left in January. I too, along with my family, were exausted after traveling and getting lost in Memphis during a storm were able to secure 2 rooms at the hotel that were supposed to be 2 of the better suites. The rooms 409 and 408 were awful. The smell was unbelievable and i cant describe it. The clerk at the desk gave us air freshner but it didn't help. After complaining, they did give my parents a better room, or so we thought. It was still not clean and furnishings had stains throughout...chairs, loveseats, ect.. Upon getting of the couch to go to the bathroom, I discovered my socks were soaked!! I realized that the carpet in the entire suite was getting wet from some source not obvious. I could not sleep, but other family members were already asleep. I went to the clerk again to tell him what was happening and to inform him that we would be leaving shortly. The rate charged for the dump, 104.00 for each room was cut in half and I received a refund for half the money. The place is a dump and should be closed by health officials!!!
